intro: Minuartia kashmirica var. foliosa, commonly known as the Kashmir leafy sandwort, is a low-growing, mat-forming plant native to the mountainous regions of the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its dense, fleshy leaves and small, white or pink flowers. The plant typically thrives in rocky, well-drained soils at high altitudes. It is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity. Due to its limited distribution and specific environmental requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
